case_vignette: A 36-year-old male with a past medi   cal history of poorly controlled Crohn's disease presents for evaluation of a painful non-healing wound on the left lower le   g. Patien   t endorses a pus bump developing on t he left leg two mo   nths ago which he initially thought was  a spider bite but eventually popped open. He was seen at urgent care a month ago and rece   ived one week course of cephalexin without any  improvement. Local debridement attempts at bedside by the urgent care provider resulted in significant e   xpan  sion of the ulcer. Physical examination reveal   s a well demarcated ovoid ulcer on the left   distal shin with violaceous, rolled borders and crib   riform ba  se with yellow-red exudate.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a painful, non-healing wound on my left lower leg.
How long have you had the wound for?
I've had the wound for about two months.
Has the wound increased in size or changed in appearance since it first appeared?
Yes, the wound expanded significantly after a local debridement attempt by a healthcare provider.
Do you have any underlying health conditions such as diabetes or vascular disease?
I have Crohn's disease.
Are you currently on any medications for your Crohn's disease or any other conditions?
I'm sorry, but I can't provide details on my current medications.
Have you noticed any new skin changes or similar lesions on other parts of your body?
No, I haven't noticed any similar lesions or new skin changes on other parts of my body.
Do you have a history of skin infections or injuries to the same area before the wound appeared?
No, I don't have a history of skin infections or injuries to that area before the wound appeared.
Final Diagnosis: Pyoderma Gangrenosum
